meanings.definition: Related to sound or the sense of hearing.
meanings.sent1: The acoustical guitar produced a beautiful sound.
meanings.sent2: The acoustical panels in the room helped reduce echoes.
meanings.sent3: The acoustical properties of the room made everyone's whispers sound like shouts.
meanings.sent4: Her acoustical sensitivity was so sharp, she could hear a pin drop from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The acoustical nature of the forest at night was both eerie and calming.

meanings.definition: Designed to enhance or control sound quality.
meanings.sent1: The acoustical curtains in the theater improved the sound during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The acoustical panels on the walls made the music clearer.
meanings.sent3: The acoustical adjustments in the studio turned even off-key singing into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His acoustical design transformed the room into a symphony hall.
meanings.sent5: The acoustical engineering of the concert hall created a magical listening experience.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the science of sound.
meanings.sent1: The acoustical research led to groundbreaking discoveries in sound propagation.
meanings.sent2: The acoustical analysis of the recording revealed hidden frequencies.
meanings.sent3: The acoustical experiments in the lab sometimes resulted in unexpected noises.
meanings.sent4: His acoustical studies opened up new possibilities in audio technology.
meanings.sent5: The acoustical investigations into dolphin communication were fascinating and enlightening.
